title: Rocket Lab launches subsidiary focused on national security market
summary: Rocket Lab USA is creating a separate entity to focus on U.S. defense and intelligence agency customers.

title: Orion capsule leaves lunar orbit, heads for moon flyby and return to Earth
summary: Continuing a “drama-free” test flight, NASA’s Orion spacecraft is set to fire its main engine Thursday to leave a distant orbit around the moon, heading for a flyby close to the lunar surface next week to swing onto a trajectory to bring it back to Earth for splashdown in the Pacific Ocean on Dec. 11.

title: Eutelsat orders GEO broadband satellite with LEO in mind
summary: Eutelsat said Dec. 1 it has ordered a geostationary broadband satellite to support multi-orbit services in the Americas from 2026.

title: FCC authorizes SpaceX to begin deploying up to 7,500 next-generation Starlink satellites
summary: The Federal Communications Commission issued a key authorization to Elon Musk’s SpaceX on Thursday, granting approval for the company to move forward with launching up to 7,500 next-generation satellites in its Starlink internet network.

title: NASA Awards Environmental Compliance, Restoration Services Contract
summary: NASA has awarded the Architect-Engineer Services Contract for Environmental Compliance and Restoration Services to Jacobs Engineering Group Inc. of Dallas, to provide environmental compliance, monitoring, and remediation services at the Santa Susana Field Laboratory (SSFL) located in Ventura County, California.

title: Solid Rocket Boosters meet performance targets in first-look data review for Artemis I
summary: The Artemis I launch of the Space Launch System (SLS) rocket from LC-39B at the Kennedy Space Center on Nov. 16, 2022, marked the first time in 11 years that the Solid Rocket Boosters (SRBs) formerly used for the Space Shuttle program lit on a launch pad and hauled a spaceship out of Earth’s dense lower atmosphere.

title: Astronomers say a new, huge satellite is as bright as the brightest stars
summary: "BlueWalker 3 is a big shift in the constellation satellite issue."

title: Cognitive Space hires retired general as strategic advisor
summary: Cognitive Space, a startup based in Houston, Texas, announced Dec. 1 that retired U.S. Air Force Maj. Gen. Aaron Prupas has joined the company as a strategic advisor.

title: NASA to Provide Live Coverage of US Spacewalks Outside Space Station
summary: Astronauts aboard the International Space Station will conduct a pair of U.S. spacewalks in December to install rollout solar arrays to increase electrical power in support of station operations and scientific research.
